prompt: Where might you click to find more options and settings?
description: This is an eReader program that lets you read books on your computer. Look at the interface and compare it to other software that you've seen or used.
feedback: Most of the controls on this software are hidden. That gives you more room to read the book. There are probably a few things that look familiar. In the upper right, there’s a search bar, and icons to close or resize the window. There’s no indication that there might be more controls there. And the center of the screen is where you read the book. That’s probably not a good place to look for controls, either. At the bottom of the screen, there’s a progress bar with forward and back buttons and page numbers--that’s probably a way to get around the book, but it doesn’t seem like there are more controls there. The tab on the left is a good place to start. The tab shows that there’s something there, so it’s a good place to look for controls.
